About Me

{

Hi! My name is Nathan Lynes.

I've obtained a Bachelor's in Computer Science at Kennesaw State University. Some of my interests include computer networking, data structure analysis, and artificial intelligence.
As of now, I'm exploring the field of game design! I've always had an interest in video games, and it's been a blast playing around with the Godot engine. Additionally, I have an interest in CNN models for image detection/analysis.

Skills

{

I have expertise in a wide array of programming languages. Web applications are preferably programmed in HTML/JavaScript, and I implement networking solutions with C or Python. Here are a few languages I know:

  • Java/JavaScript
  • C/C#/C++
  • Python
  • HTML/CSS/SCSS
  • SQL/R

Education

Bachelor's of Computer Science

Here, I spent my time studying artificial intelligences—with a preference for CNN image detection/analysis—data structures, and computer networking. While building experience with various technologies, I held a passion for leading class projects. This taught me valuable skills in communication, teambuilding, and patience.

Portfolio

{

These are some projects I am very proud of.

This Website
This website was created as a display of my professional and technical experience. In doing this project, I have improved my skills in both HTML and SCSS/CSS.

Multisim Project

At KSU, my team and I used Multisim—a circuit drafting software—to create a breadboard. This was a very fun project for me because I gained insight into how hardware behaves.
As for what the breadboard does, it simply follows an input table. Whatever the user inputs is sent to a decoder that activates various sub-circuits.

Browser Buddy
This is the senior project for my degree!
In short, Browser Buddy is a web extension that uses the OpenAI ChatGPT-4 API for summarizing websites. I enjoyed my time working with my team here, as it allowed me to experience leadership while staying within a budget and schedule.
Here is the official website for the project.
